channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Biden focuses on outreach to Black Americans; Billie Eilish finds herself
item.description: President Biden will cap off a week of outreach to Black Americans with commencement at Morehouse College. Billie Eilish tells Morning Edition how she found herself on her newest album.
item.content:encoded: President Biden will cap off a week of outreach to Black Americans with commencement at Morehouse College. Billie Eilish tells Morning Edition how she found herself on her newest album.
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: We asked, you answered: What's the secret to a close relationship with siblings?
item.description: As part of our series on "the Science of Siblings," we looked at how some brothers and sisters are best friends. Here are some of the stories you shared of close ties with siblings.
item.content:encoded: As part of our series on "the Science of Siblings," we looked at how some brothers and sisters are best friends. Here are some of the stories you shared of close ties with siblings.
item.dc:creator: Gisele Grayson

item.title: French police fatally shoot a man suspected of planning to set fire to a synagogue
item.description: French police shot and killed a man armed with a knife and a metal bar who is suspected of having set fire to a synagogue in the Normandy city of Rouen early on Friday, authorities said.
item.content:encoded: French police shot and killed a man armed with a knife and a metal bar who is suspected of having set fire to a synagogue in the Normandy city of Rouen early on Friday, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Lessons from rattlesnake class in the American Southwest
item.description: It's rattlesnake season in Arizona, where the number of bites has surged. And it turns out most of what you thought you knew about the reptiles isn't true.
item.content:encoded:
It's rattlesnake season in Arizona, where the number of bites has surged. And it turns out most of what you thought you knew about the reptiles isn't true.

(Image credit: Alina Hartounian)
item.dc:creator: Alina Hartounian

item.title: Family of Black U.S. Airman seeks answers after fatal shooting by Florida deputy
item.description: Roger Fortson, a 23-year-old senior airman, was shot and killed at his apartment by a deputy this month. Lawyers for the family dispute the sheriff's office claim of self defense.
item.content:encoded: Roger Fortson, a 23-year-old senior airman, was shot and killed at his apartment by a deputy this month. Lawyers for the family dispute the sheriff's office claim of self defense.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: Biden will cap off a week of outreach to Black Americans with Morehouse commencement
item.description: President Biden met with plaintiffs from the Brown v. Board of Education case Thursday. On Friday, he's meeting with members of historically Black sororities and fraternities.
item.content:encoded: President Biden met with plaintiffs from the Brown v. Board of Education case Thursday. On Friday, he's meeting with members of historically Black sororities and fraternities.
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: What did the internet call 'satanic'? Find out in the news quiz
item.description: What looks like "a ghost emerging from a pool of vomit"? Are meme stocks back? And what's up with the Trump-Biden debates? Plus: orcas with a thirst for violence and more Miss USA drama.
item.content:encoded: What looks like "a ghost emerging from a pool of vomit"? Are meme stocks back? And what's up with the Trump-Biden debates? Plus: orcas with a thirst for violence and more Miss USA drama.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: U.S. military says aid is now being delivered into Gaza over a floating pier
item.description: The shipment is the first in an operation that U.S. military officials anticipate could scale up to 150 truckloads a day entering the Gaza Strip as Israel presses in on the southern city of Rafah.
item.content:encoded: The shipment is the first in an operation that U.S. military officials anticipate could scale up to 150 truckloads a day entering the Gaza Strip as Israel presses in on the southern city of Rafah.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: At least 4 people are killed in Houston after a severe thunderstorm passed through
item.description: Across the city, power lines and trees are downed, traffic lights are out and glass is scattered across downtown. About 900,000 customers were left without power early Friday.
item.content:encoded: Across the city, power lines and trees are downed, traffic lights are out and glass is scattered across downtown. About 900,000 customers were left without power early Friday.
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Arrests at the U.S. border fall in April, bucking usual spring increase
item.description: U.S. officials have largely attributed the decline to more enforcement in Mexico, including in yards where migrants are known to board freight trains.
item.content:encoded: U.S. officials have largely attributed the decline to more enforcement in Mexico, including in yards where migrants are known to board freight trains.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
